strings.onboardLongDescription: Discover the volcanic sand beaches, cool off in the natural salt-water pools, and head to a seaside restaurant for a glass of homemade sangria.

agendaPreview.noBookingText: You don’t currently have any bookings for this day. Go ahead and fill your boots!

activities.longDescription: Tenerife’s waters are teeming with marine life for you to discover. After splitting into groups of certified divers and those diving for their very first time, a dive guide will go over the necessary skills and equipment to plunge you into the underwater realm. Whether this is your first foray into the ocean, or you’ve been diving multiple times, this subterranean journey will offer you a lifetime of memories and a new experience of exploring the world below the waves.
highlightDetails: Experience the wonders of the underwater world unique to the shores of Tenerife
See a myriad of fish living in hidden caves and along the coral reef while looking for turtles and rays
All Sailors will be fitted and receive necessary equipment that will be used before and during their dive
Certified divers and Sailors brand new to diving will be split into groups according to their skill level
An average water temperature of 68-75°F in Tenerife makes for perfect diving conditions
activities.introduction: Discover the vast marine life hidden in Abades' protected waters in a scuba diving experience fit for pros and newbies alike.
instructionDetails: Please be aware this Shore Thing is not wheelchair accessible
Sailors previously diagnosed with COVID-19 or who have a medical history must bring a medical questionnaire completed and signed by a physician
This Shore Thing is not suitable for pregnant Sailors
This Shore Thing is considered 'daring' and not for the faint of heart. Sailors are reminded that they assume full risk and responsibility
This experience is not suitable for Sailors with vertigo
Sailors should consider their physical fitness level and medical history when determining whether this Shore Thing is appropriate
Please consult a medical professional prior to selecting this experience
Sailors should know how to swim
This Shore Thing operator has received third-party certification based on the Global Sustainable Tourism Council criteria
Certified divers need to provide proof of an Open Water diving certification (PADI, SSI, etc.) to participate in the Open Water group dive
Certified divers should bring a SCUBA certification card or know their details associated with their certification agency
Certified divers who cannot provide proof of certification may participate in the beginner dive, but will not be paired with Open Water divers
Certified divers will adhere to their instructor/divemaster’s dive plan, including staying above the max depth indicated by their guide
Non-Certified Sailors do not require any certification to participate in their beginner dive
Non-certified Sailors will not receive a certification upon completion of their dive
Non-Certified Sailors may only go to a max depth of 30-40ft with their guide
Wildlife sightings are not guaranteed
This Shore Thing is weather dependent

activities.longDescription: Head south to Abades, a tiny beach town with golden sand and azure waters that teem with marine life. With ocean temperatures ranging from 68–75°F throughout the year, many schools of fish, turtles, and rays and the endangered Angel Shark can be spotted in the area’s hidden caves and remarkable coral reef. After meeting your instructor, you'll get acquainted with your snorkeling equipment, get ready, and plunge into a great time.
highlightDetails: See a myriad of fish living among the coral and in hidden caves while looking out for turtles and rays
Offering perfect conditions for pros and newbies alike, Abades' calm waters hide a lively marine ecosystem protected by the Canarian government
Go snorkeling and share the sea with Tenerife's vast marine life
activities.introduction: Discover the vast marine life hidden in Abades' protected waters in a snorkeling experience fit for pros and newbies alike.

activities.displayName: A Heli of a Flight Over Tenerife
activities.shortDescription: Fly over pretty villages, the coast, and a volcano
activities.longDescription: Get a one-of-a-kind view of Tenerife's unique topography, starting with two fishing villages that are just a stone's throw away from the island's wildest areas. Feel La Caleta's dreamy atmosphere and experience Playa San Juan's serene vibes as you fly over the coast. Then, see Alcalá and its most prestigious spots, gaze at Los Gigantes' massive cliffs, and hover past the striking Teide National Park — a UNESCO World Heritage Site with the highest point on Spanish soil: an ancient volcano's peak.
highlightDetails: Catch sight of inaccessible natural wonders in a once-in-a-lifetime experience
Go on a scenic helicopter ride for a bird's-eye view of the Canary Islands' natural beauty
Fly over Tenerife's breathtaking coastline and locate some of its hidden natural treasures
activities.introduction: See epic views in epic style! Take off on a scenic helicopter ride over Tenerife and see its breathtaking sights from above.
instructionDetails: Exclusive to Virgin Voyages
Please be aware this Shore Thing is not wheelchair accessible
This Shore Thing is considered 'daring' and not for the faint of heart. Sailors are reminded that they assume full risk and responsibility
This experience is not suitable for Sailors with vertigo
The Sailor's weight should not exceed 240 lbs. for this particular Shore Thing
Passport is required
Approximately 1-hour and 15-minute drive to your Shore Thing destination
Approximately 20 minutes of flight time
This Shore Thing is weather dependent
A donation will be made on behalf of your Shore Thing booking to our environmental and social impact charity partners
This Shore Thing operator has received third-party certification based on the Global Sustainable Tourism Council criteria

activities.shortDescription: Panoramic views, wine tasting, and lots of culture
activities.longDescription: Find one of Tenerife's best hidden gems: Sauzal. Perched on a cliff, the quaint village is one enormous panoramic viewing point where you'll see vineyards lining the rocky grounds, Orotava valley's wooded hills and banana plantations, a striking volcanic peak in the middle of the island, and the shimmering blues of the ocean. Then, head to Casa del Vino to taste the local wine paired with mixed cheeses and honey before strolling through Laguna's charming Old Town, a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
highlightDetails: Discover Sauzal, a quiet hilltop town filled with wooden-balcony houses and breathtaking views of Tenerife
Taste the local wine paired with mixed cheeses and honey at the charming Casa del Vino — a worthy representation of the island's historic haciendas
End your day trip exploring La Laguna's picturesque Old Town, a UNESCO World Heritage Site
activities.introduction: Get sweeping views of Tenerife from an old village nestled on top of a hill, sip on the island's wine, and visit La Laguna.
instructionDetails: Please be aware this Shore Thing is not wheelchair accessible
This tour includes driving through winding roads
Sailors prone to motion sickness should take precautions prior to this Shore Thing
Comfortable walking shoes are recommended
Includes tastings of local specialties
Approximately 1-hour drive

activities.displayName: Cooking Class at a Canarian Mansion
activities.shortDescription: Learn how to make papas con mojos at a mansion
activities.longDescription: Go on a day trip to La Orotava, a charming town known for its traditional architecture, 17th-century houses, and gorgeous palaces. See its beautiful churches and tiny cobblestone streets on your way to an unforgettable cooking experience at Casa Lercaro, an ancient Canarian mansion. There, you'll learn how to make papas con mojos and taste your own creation before kicking back in a nice ride back to the port.
highlightDetails: Embark on an extraordinary cooking experience and explore the rich flavors of Canarian cuisine
Visit La Orotava, a charming town known for its classic buildings, 17th-century homes, and impressive mansions
Discover the secrets to cooking an authentic Canarian dish in an ancient mansion
activities.introduction: Visit a mansion in La Orotava, learn how to prepare papas con mojos, and taste your work in a one-of-a-kind cooking class.

Comfortable walking shoes are recommended

activities.shortDescription: Hike the top of the world's third-highest volcano
activities.longDescription: Discover the fascinating world of volcanic formations while hiking the world's third-highest volcano. Catch a cable car ride to El Teide's summit and admire the unique volcanic landscape around you. See ancient lava streams as you ascend to the upper cable car station. Then, take in jaw-dropping views of Tenerife and the other Canary Islands on the Atlantic Sea before heading toward Pico Viejo Viewpoint for a one-of-a-king hike.
highlightDetails: Feel like you're at the top of the world after reaching the exceptional Pico Viejo viewpoint
Jump in a cable car and see old lava streams on your way up to the top cable car station, located just below the tip of the volcano
Experience the thrills of hiking an ancient volcanic formation at the highest peak in Spain
activities.introduction: Take a scenic cable car ride to El Teide's summit, hike to its tip, and admire the incredible volcanic landscape below.
instructionDetails: Please be aware this Shore Thing is not wheelchair accessible
Sailors should consider their physical fitness level and medical history when determining whether this Shore Thing is appropriate
Approximately 2-hour drive to/from your destination
Approximately 2-hour hike
Not recommended for Sailors with walking difficulties
Sailors must wear suitable clothing and footwear for this activity (hiking, biking, trekking, rappelling, ziplining, yoga, etc.)
This Shore Thing is weather dependent
Closed-toed shoes are required

activities.shortDescription: Experience a day at Las Teresitas
activities.longDescription: Experience a day at Playa de las Teresitas, a breathtaking beach where the sand has been imported from the Sahara Desert — they won’t miss it — and palm trees sway in the warm sea breeze for a spectacular mile. From a private spot at the stunning Bambú Beach, you'll get to take in the seaside views while sipping on welcome bevvie from the chiringito (an island beach bar) and lay on your fab sun lounger to bask in the island sun.
highlightDetails: Enjoy the famous Playa de las Teresitas — considered one of the most beautiful beaches on the island by locals and tourists alike
Take in the idyllic views right from your sun lounger and under your own canopy umbrella
activities.introduction: Spend a fabulous day on one of Tenerife's most beautiful beaches — Playa de las Teresitas.
instructionDetails: Please be aware this Shore Thing is not wheelchair accessible
Approximately 30-minutes of driving to/from your destination
Sun loungers and umbrellas are included
This Shore Thing operator has received third-party certification based on the Global Sustainable Tourism Council criteria

activities.displayName: La Laguna, La Orotava & La Delicious Wine Tasting
activities.shortDescription: Take in the views before taking in the wine
activities.longDescription: Embark on a scenic ride to La Laguna, a charming colonial town designated a World Heritage Site by UNESCO. Stroll through the historic city center's narrow streets to find emblematic buildings, pastel-hued mansions, and the famous Plaza del Cristo. Then, make a stop at Mirador de Humboldt for a striking panorama over the Orotava Valley on your way to La Orotava, a lovely town famous for its traditional architecture. After touring the village, head to Tacoronte to taste delicious local wine.
highlightDetails: Visit Tacoronte, a rural village known for its outstanding wines, and taste the variety grown in the gorgeous local valley
Take in sweeping views over the lush Orotava Valley and vast banana plantations from Mirador de Humboldt
Tour the famous Plaza del Cristo and explore the colorful fresh market
Follow a guide through La Laguna's narrow streets to find small shops, 17th-Century houses, beautiful palaces, and striking architectural monuments
activities.introduction: See everything from vast banana plantations to architectural gems before tasting the exquisite Tacoronte wine.

activities.displayName: Remote Villages and Tiny Masca Adventure
activities.shortDescription: Find the incredible villages lost around Tenerife
activities.longDescription: Starting with scenic views over the Orotava Valley from Mirador de Humbold, you'll see the rugged cliff that forms the northwestern tip of the island, then go down on a narrow winding road to discover the tiny Masca perched at a deep gorge. With its main center running along the brink of a knife-edge ridge, it looks as if a hint of wind would blow the town off its steep nest. After having lunch at Mirador Garachico, you'll head to Icod de Los Vinos to see an 800-year-old Dragon Tree.
highlightDetails: See Icod de Los Vinos' ancient Dragon Tree, declared a National Monument in 1917
Discover the impressive tiny village of Masca sitting at the tip of a steep, knife-edge ridge
See El Palmar valley and the rugged cliff that forms the northwestern tip of Tenerife
Drive toward Garachico's woody slopes and rocky coastline, then admire Tenerife's extraordinary landscape while eating tapas for lunch
Make a stop at the famous Mirador de Humbold and take in epic views over Puerto de la Cruz, Orotava Valley, and the lush banana plantations
activities.introduction: Go on a fantastic ride across the Tenerife in search of the most remote (and mind-blowing) villages on the island.

activities.shortDescription: Unwind on a scenic ride before exploring on foot
activities.longDescription: Discover Tenerife, the largest of the Canary Islands and capital city. Starting with a scenic ride around the island, you'll see lush valleys filled with banana trees turn into stunning beaches guarded by steep hills. Stop at Mirador de Humboldt to look over the Orotava Valley and visit San Pedro to take in striking views of the northern coast. Then, follow your guide through the colorful streets of La Laguna to explore its historic city center, a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
highlightDetails: Have a glass of wine while tasting different types of cheese in one of the many local bars
Explore La Laguna's historic city center, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, on foot
Get in some panoramic views from Mirador de Humboldt before visiting the lovely San Pedro
activities.introduction: Exotic nature, dramatic views, sandy beaches, and World Heritage Sites—Tenerife has it all.

activities.shortDescription: Witness wild whales aboard a Catamaran
activities.longDescription: Tenerife is one of the best places to spot Pilot Whales and Bottlenose Dolphins and now’s your chance to see these amazing creatures in the wild. On a catamaran, you’ll head into the waters between Santa Cruz Pier and Playa de Las Americas where 20+ species of cetaceans (whales and dolphins) are known to congregate, so keep your eyes peeled. When you want to feel as free as your dorsal-finned friends, we’ve got just the spot for you to jump into the majestic waters — perfect just for swimming.
highlightDetails: Embark on a Catamaran for a glimpse of different whale and dolphin species
Sail across the Canarian waters where multiple whale and dolphin species swim throughout the year
Relax with refreshing bevvies and cool off with a swim in the tempting azure waters of the Atlantic Ocean
activities.introduction: Board a Catamaran to look for wild whales, and find the best spot for a refreshing dip in the ocean.
